verses.sanskrit:
अङ्गं हरेः पुलकभूषणमाश्रयन्ती
भृङ्गाङ्गनेव मुकुलाभरणं तमालम्।
अङ्गीकृतांघ्रिकमलां हरसौभगार्थं
माङ्गल्यदास्तु मम मङ्गलदेवतायाः॥
verses.transliteration:
aṅgaṃ hareḥ pulakabhūṣaṇamāśrayantī
bhṛṅgāṅganeva mukulābharaṇaṃ tamālam।
aṅgīkṛtāṅghrikamalāṃ harasaubhagārthaṃ
māṅgalyadāstu mama maṅgaladevatāyāḥ॥
verses.meaning: She who dwells on the chest of Lord Hari adorned with divine marks, like a bee rests on a dark tamala tree adorned with buds, who has accepted the lotus feet of Lord Shiva for bringing auspiciousness - may that Goddess of all auspiciousness grant me prosperity.

verses.sanskrit:
मुग्धा मुहुर्विदधती वदने मुरारेः
प्रेमत्रपाप्रणिहितानि गतागतानि।
मालाकरस्य वलयन्ति चिरेण तस्या
माणिक्यमौलिमणिभूषितपादपीठम्॥
verses.transliteration:
mugdhā muhurvid adhatī vadane murāreḥ
prematrapāpraṇihitāni gatāgatāni।
mālākarasya valayanti cireṇa tasyā
māṇikyamaul imaṇibhūṣitapādapīṭham॥
verses.meaning: The innocent Goddess, shy with love, repeatedly comes and goes to the face of Lord Murari. For a long time, the garland maker (devotee) revolves around Her footstool decorated with ruby crown jewels.

verses.sanskrit:
कालेन धीमहि मही विलसत्कुचाभोः
कालेन भाति भगवान्मणिलालितांगः।
कालेन भाति निचुलेन विचित्रमम्बा
मालाकरोऽयमभितस्तव पादपीठम्॥
verses.transliteration:
kālena dhīmahi mahī vilasatkucābhoḥ
kālena bhāti bhagavānmaṇilālitāṅgaḥ।
kālena bhāti niculena vicitramambā
mālākaro'yamabhitastava pādapīṭham॥
verses.meaning: In time, we meditate on the earth with splendid mountains. In time, the Lord whose body is adorned with jewels shines. In time, O Mother, the wonderful garland maker shines around Your footstool with various offerings.

On the golden and ruby peaks, with Manmatha (Cupid), performing the play of love in the house prepared in the morning, playing on the ruby stones - O Mistress, I am among those who enjoy the honey of Your lotus feet.

verses.sanskrit:
हिरण्मयेन कलशेन सुधाम्बुपूर्णं
कुर्वन्तु दानमपरं न च मामकीनाम्।
कुर्वन्तु दानपदवीं न तथेतरेऽस्मै
कुर्वन्तु दाने जननि प्रथमं श्रियं माम्॥
verses.transliteration:
hiraṇmayena kalaśena sudhāmbupūrṇaṃ
kurvantu dānamaparaṃ na ca māmakīnām।
kurvantu dānapadavīṃ na tathetre'smai
kurvantu dāne janani prathamaṃ śriyaṃ mām॥
verses.meaning: With a golden pot filled with nectar water, let them give charity to others, not to mine. Let them follow the path of charity, not so to others but to me. O Mother, in giving charity, make me the first recipient of prosperity.
O glorious Mahalakshmi, O Mother, sometime seeing the poor with compassionate and kind eyes, with a full vessel like an ocean, may You abundantly bestow the wealth of all objects.

verses.sanskrit:
श्रीं ह्रीं क्लीं ऐं सौः ॐ ह्रीं श्रीं
का ए ई ल ह्रीं ह स क ल ह्रीं
स क ल ह्रीं सौः ऐं क्लीं ह्रीं श्रीं॥
कनकधारां वर्षय वर्षय कनकधाराम्॥
verses.transliteration:
śrīṃ hrīṃ klīṃ aiṃ sauḥ oṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ
kā e ī la hrīṃ ha sa ka la hrīṃ
sa ka la hrīṃ sauḥ aiṃ klīṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ॥
kanakadhārāṃ varṣaya varṣaya kanakadhārām॥
verses.meaning: With the seed mantras of Lakshmi - Shreem, Hreem, Kleem, Aim, Sau, Om - shower, shower the stream of gold (wealth), shower the stream of prosperity upon me!

verses.sanskrit:
आपत्सु मग्नः स्मरणं त्वदीयं
करोमि दुर्गे करुणार्णवेशि।
नैतच्छठत्वं मम भावयेथाः
क्षुधातुरः काष्ठकुटीं समाश्रयते॥
verses.transliteration:
āpatsu magnaḥ smaraṇaṃ tvadīyaṃ
karomi durge karuṇārṇaveśi।
naitacchaṭhatvaṃ mama bhāvayethāḥ
kṣudhāturaḥ kāṣṭhakuṭīṃ samāśrayate॥
verses.meaning: Immersed in calamities, I remember You, O Durga, O ocean of compassion. Do not consider this as my cunning - when one is afflicted with hunger, he naturally takes shelter in a home with food.

verses.sanskrit:
दृष्ट्वा घोरं दरिद्रताहिमगृहं गोधूलिधूसरितं
भ्रष्टा सर्वा परिच्छदोपचयपरम्परा क्षुद्भिः।
द्रष्टुं कामा यदि जगदधीशापि तत्तद्भवानि
प्रास्तु प्रत्यूषसमयसुधाभोजनं कनकेन॥
verses.transliteration:
dṛṣṭvā ghoraṃ daridratāhimagṛhaṃ godhūlidhūsaritaṃ
bhraṣṭā sarvā paricchadopacayaparamparā kṣudbhiḥ।
draṣṭuṃ kāmā yadi jagadadhīśāpi tattadbhavāni
prāstu pratyūṣasamayasudhābhojanaṃ kanakena॥
verses.meaning: Seeing the terrible house of poverty covered with the dust of evening, all household utensils lost due to hunger - if the Goddess of the universe wishes to see that, O Bhavani, please bestow the nectar meal of early morning with gold.

verses.sanskrit:
कनकधारास्तवराजसंज्ञोऽयं शङ्कराचार्यकृतः प्रबन्धः।
भुक्तिं मुक्तिं च वितरति नित्यं पठद्भ्यः श्रीमत्॥
verses.transliteration:
kanakadhārāstavarājasaṃjño'yaṃ śaṅkarācāryakṛtaḥ prabandhaḥ।
bhuktiṃ muktiṃ ca vitarati nityaṃ paṭhadbhyaḥ śrīmat॥
verses.meaning: This composition called Kanakadhara Stotram, the king of hymns, created by Shankaracharya, bestows both material prosperity (bhukti) and spiritual liberation (mukti) to those who recite it regularly.
